Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery krater. Inside glazed; outside, central parts of two females facing right, the one on the left possibly attacking.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

W. Kraiker, Die rotfigurigen attischen Vasen (1978) p. 51, no. 192, Suppl. pl. 10, 192. Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1098)
